title: Complete Summary of Changes
text: {r fig.alt="Map joined ADM1 geometries", fig.cap="ADM1 map joined example data"} plot(sf::st_geometry(joined)) ensures ["0"] stays array JSON.
code: # BEFORE: joined <- tryCatch(mn_join_by_name(dat, name_col = "name", level = "ADM1"), error = function(e) adm1) ```{r fig.alt="Map of joined ADM1 geometries", fig.cap="ADM1 map joined to example data"} plot(sf::st_geometry(joined)) # AFTER: joined <- tryCatch(mn_join_by_name(dat, name_col = "name", level = "ADM1"), error = function(e) adm1) ### 4. tests/testthat/test-integration.R (NEW FILE)  Created comprehensive integration test suite with 7 test cases:  1. **Basic data fetching**: Validates nso_data works with valid table and selections 2. **Label selections**: Tests English label-based dimension selection 3. **Code selections**: Tests numeric code-based dimension selection 4. **Multiple values**: Tests selecting multiple dimension values (Male + Female) 5. **Period extraction**: Tests nso_table_periods function 6. **Batch operations**: Tests nso_package with multiple tables 7. **Label-code equivalence**: Validates that label and code selections return same data  All tests include: - `skip_on_cran()` for CRAN compatibility - `skip_if_offline()` for network dependency handling - `tryCatch()` for graceful failure - Proper tibble class validation - Row count and column presence checks  ## Technical Details  ### JSON Auto-Unboxing Issue  **Problem**: jsonlite's `auto_unbox = TRUE` converts single-element vectors to scalars: - `["0"]` becomes `"0"` - PXWeb API expects array format, returns HTTP 400 for scalar  **Solution**: Wrap values with `I()` (AsIs class) to prevent auto-unboxing: ```r values = I(as.character(vals))

title: Complete Summary of Changes

title: Complete Summary of Changes
text: Problem: Response jsonlite::fromJSON(..., simplifyVector = FALSE) returns list, data frame. Subsetting syntax cols[cols$type == "d"] failed. Solution: Use Filter() function list filtering:
code: Filter(function(col) !is.null(col$type) && col$type == "d", cols)

title: CRITICAL FIX for mongolstats 400 Bad Request Error
text: Getting HTTP 400 Bad Request calling nso_data() - even though manual curl tests work perfectly!

title: CRITICAL FIX for mongolstats 400 Bad Request Error
text: JSON Array Auto-Unboxing Issue R‚Äôs jsonlite (used internally httr2::req_body_json()) serializes single-element vectors, auto-unboxes scalars:
code: # What we had: vals <- "0"  # Single string # Gets serialized as: "values": "0"  ‚ùå WRONG!  # What PXWeb expects: # "values": ["0"]  ‚úì CORRECT!

title: CRITICAL FIX for mongolstats 400 Bad Request Error
text: File: R/pxweb.R line 268
code: # Before: response = list(format = "JSON")  # ‚ùå Uppercase  # After: response = list(format = "json")  # ‚úì Lowercase

title: CRITICAL FIX for mongolstats 400 Bad Request Error
text: File: R/pxweb.R lines 262, 265 () works: () function wraps values ‚ÄúAsIs‚Äù class, telling jsonlite preserve arrays even contain one element.
code: # Before (line 262): values = vals  # ‚ùå Single values get unboxed to scalars  # After (line 262): values = I(as.character(vals))  # ‚úì I() prevents unboxing  # Before (line 265): values = vv  # ‚ùå Could be unboxed  # After (line 265): values = I(as.character(vv))  # ‚úì Always an array

title: CRITICAL FIX for mongolstats 400 Bad Request Error

code: rm test_*.sh test_*.R debug_*.R rebuild_index.R add_missing_table.py git add R/pxweb.R git add vignettes/getting-started.Rmd vignettes/mapping.Rmd git add tests/testthat/test-integration.R git add NAMESPACE man/  # if roxygen updated these

title: Phase 7: Rebuild Documentation and Verification Instructions
text: completing steps: - Package passes R CMD check issues - vignettes knit successfully - Integration tests validate core functionality - Documentation date - pkgdown site displays correctly

title: Phase 7: Rebuild Documentation and Verification Instructions
text: encounter errors step, check: - Internet connectivity (tests require API access) - API availability data.1212.mn - Correct versions dependencies - Clear cached objects devtools::clean_dll() tests fail intermittently, may due : - API rate limiting - Network timeouts - Temporary API unavailability integration tests use skip_on_cran() skip_if_offline() handle gracefully.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: Source: R/ (exported functions use nso_* mn_*; internal helpers start .) Data/docs: inst/extdata/px_index.json, man/, vignettes/ Tests: tests/testthat/ Metadata: DESCRIPTION, NAMESPACE, _pkgdown.yml Tooling: tools/ (build, check, site)

title: Repository Guidelines
text: Quick smoke test: Rscript tools/smoke.R Run unit tests: Rscript -e "invisible(lapply(list.files('R', full.names=TRUE), source)); library(testthat); test_dir('tests/testthat', reporter='summary')" Regenerate Rd docs: Rscript -e "roxygen2::roxygenise()" Build pkgdown site: Rscript tools/build_site.R Full R CMD check: Rscript tools/full_check.R

title: Repository Guidelines
text: R style: 2‚Äëspace indent, snake_case object names, explicit arguments, vectorized dplyr/purrr possible. Internal helpers: prefix . keep small/composable; avoid side effects. Document exported functions roxygen2; keep examples light non‚Äënetworked default. Prefer high‚Äëlevel PXWeb wrappers (nso_*) bespoke HTTP code; update inst/extdata/px_index.json changing discovery/indexing.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: Framework: testthat (edition 3). Place tests tests/testthat/ test-*.R. Cover core flows: discovery, variables, data fetching, periods, geography joins (exact/fuzzy). Tests must pass locally via command ; add fixtures skip network needed.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: Use Conventional Commits: feat:, fix:, docs:, chore:, ci:, refactor: optional scope (e.g., fix(pxweb): ‚Ä¶). PRs include: concise description, linked issues, reproduction steps, impact docs/tests. opening PR: run roxygenise (refresh NAMESPACE/man/), run tests, (optionally) build site.

title: Repository Guidelines
text: Keep changes minimal ergonomic users; favor additive APIs. Centralize HTTP behavior R/http.R; cache via R/cache.R provided toggles. geography, normalize names provided helpers avoid introducing new external services without discussion.

title: Batch fetching workflows
code: reqs <- list(   list(tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2", selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = "2024")),   list(tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_004V5", selections = list(Year = "2024")) ) reqs ## [[1]] ## [[1]]$tbl_id ## [1] "DT_NSO_0300_001V2" ##  ## [[1]]$selections ## [[1]]$selections$Sex ## [1] "Total" ##  ## [[1]]$selections$Age ## [1] "Total" ##  ## [[1]]$selections$Year ## [1] "2024" ##  ##  ##  ## [[2]] ## [[2]]$tbl_id ## [1] "DT_NSO_0300_004V5" ##  ## [[2]]$selections ## [[2]]$selections$Year ## [1] "2024"

title: Batch fetching workflows
text: batch includes different tables, nso_package() adds tbl_id column, enabling grouped summaries:
code: pkg %>%   dplyr::group_by(tbl_id) %>%   dplyr::summarise(total = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE), n = dplyr::n()) ## # A tibble: 2 √ó 3 ##   tbl_id               total     n ##   <chr>                <dbl> <int> ## 1 DT_NSO_0300_001V2  3441598     1 ## 2 DT_NSO_0300_004V5 34415980  6660

title: Batch fetching workflows

title: Code-based joins with mongolstats
text: Prefer ISO-like stable keys (e.g., shapeISO) names available. Keep crosswalks version control (e.g., inst/extdata/‚Ä¶) document provenance. Validate joins checking unmatched rows duplicates key.

title: Discovering tables and variables
text: PXWeb exposes tree folders (sectors/subsectors) containing tables. Discovery functions help : Navigate catalog nso_sectors() nso_subsectors() List available tables nso_itms() Search keyword nso_itms_search() / nso_search() Explore table‚Äôs variables using nso_variables()

title: Discovering tables and variables
code: itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% dplyr::select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm, strt_prd, end_prd) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 √ó 4 ##    tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                strt_prd end_prd ##    <chr>              <chr>                                     <chr>    <chr>   ##  1 DT_NSO_0100_001V10 BALANCE OF PAYMENTS, by month             NA       NA      ##  2 DT_NSO_0300_010V5  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOL‚Ä¶ 2025-09‚Ä¶ 2024-0‚Ä¶ ##  3 DT_NSO_0303_07V7   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶ ##  4 DT_NSO_0303_07V8   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶ ##  5 DT_NSO_0303_07V9   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶ ##  6 DT_NSO_0600_001V3  NATIONAL BASE CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by g‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶ ##  7 DT_NSO_0600_001V4  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOL‚Ä¶ 2025-09‚Ä¶ 2021-0‚Ä¶ ##  8 DT_NSO_0600_002V1  NATIONAL CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, 1991-1-16‚Ä¶ 2024     1991    ##  9 DT_NSO_0600_002V21 CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by group, compared‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶ ## 10 DT_NSO_0600_002V22 CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, by group, compared‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶

title: Discovering tables and variables
text: Top-level categories (folder-like nodes): Children category (pass id ):
code: root <- nso_sectors() root %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 8 √ó 3 ##   id                    type  text                  ##   <chr>                 <chr> <chr>                 ## 1 Economy, environment  l     Economy, environment  ## 2 Education, health     l     Education, health     ## 3 Historical data       l     Historical data       ## 4 Industry, service     l     Industry, service     ## 5 Labour, business      l     Labour, business      ## 6 Population, household l     Population, household ## 7 Regional development  l     Regional development  ## 8 Society, development  l     Society, development first_id <- if (nrow(root)) root$id[1] else "" kids <- nso_subsectors(first_id) kids %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 √ó 3 ##    id                             type  text                           ##    <chr>                          <chr> <chr>                          ##  1 Balance of Payments            l     Balance of Payments            ##  2 Consumer Price Index           l     Consumer Price Index           ##  3 Environment                    l     Environment                    ##  4 Environmental-Economic Account l     Environmental-Economic Account ##  5 Foreign Trade                  l     Foreign Trade                  ##  6 Government budget              l     Government budget              ##  7 Housing price index            l     Housing price index            ##  8 Investment                     l     Investment                     ##  9 Money and Finance              l     Money and Finance              ## 10 National Accounts              l     National Accounts

title: Discovering tables and variables

what: Multi-year pulls and quick trend summaries
title: Fetching data and working with periods
text: prefer quick base plot interactive work:
code: yrs <- head(periods, 5) series <- nso_data(   tbl_id = tbl,   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yrs) )  series %>%   dplyr::group_by(Year) %>%   dplyr::summarise(value = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   dplyr::arrange(Year) ## # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 ##   Year    value ##   <chr>   <dbl> ## 1 0     3441598 ## 2 1     3396788 ## 3 2     3368632 ## 4 3     3312275 ## 5 4     3253283 trend <- series %>% dplyr::group_by(Year) %>% dplyr::summarise(value = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE)) if (nrow(trend) > 1) plot(as.numeric(trend$Year), trend$value, type = "b", main = "Total by Year", xlab = "Year", ylab = "Value")

title: Fuzzy name joins with mongolstats
text: Use max_distance conservatively (e.g., 1‚Äì2) avoid incorrect matches. can supply different string distance method stringdist installed; Jaro-Winkler Levenshtein common choices. Always review near ties ambiguous matches manually; consider exporting candidate pairs QA dataset critical.

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: vignette introduces core workflow using mongolstats: Discover tables explore variables (codebooks) Fetch data selecting values table dimension Optionally enrich English/Mongolian labels readability Work period utilities time series ‚Äôll keep examples small clarity; see vignettes discovery, periods, mapping, batch workflows.

title: Getting started with mongolstats
code: itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("tbl_id", "tbl_eng_nm", "strt_prd", "end_prd"))) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) ## # A tibble: 5 √ó 4 ##   tbl_id             tbl_eng_nm                                 strt_prd end_prd ##   <chr>              <chr>                                      <chr>    <chr>   ## 1 DT_NSO_0100_001V10 BALANCE OF PAYMENTS, by month              NA       NA      ## 2 DT_NSO_0300_010V5  WEEKLY PRICES OF MAIN PRODUCTS AND GASOLI‚Ä¶ 2025-09‚Ä¶ 2024-0‚Ä¶ ## 3 DT_NSO_0303_07V7   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared ‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶ ## 4 DT_NSO_0303_07V8   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared ‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶ ## 5 DT_NSO_0303_07V9   CONSUMER PRICE INDEX IN AIMAGS, compared ‚Ä¶ 2015=100 2023=1‚Ä¶

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: Notes PXWeb table one dimensions (e.g., Year, Sex, Age). Use labels select values. can pass values codes labels; mongolstats maps labels codes hood .
code: vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% dplyr::count(field) ## # A tibble: 3 √ó 2 ##   field     n ##   <chr> <int> ## 1 Age      88 ## 2 Sex       3 ## 3 Year     25 vars %>% dplyr::filter(field %in% c("Sex","Age","Year")) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 10 √ó 6 ##    field itm_id scr_eng scr_mn px_path                                   px_file ##    <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>                                     <chr>   ##  1 Sex   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  2 Sex   1      Male    NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  3 Sex   2      Female  NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  4 Age   0      Total   NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  5 Age   1      0       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  6 Age   2      1       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  7 Age   3      2       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  8 Age   4      3       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ##  9 Age   5      4       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶ ## 10 Age   6      5       NA     Population, household/1_Population, hous‚Ä¶ DT_NSO‚Ä¶

title: Getting started with mongolstats
code: per <- tryCatch(tail(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), 1), error = function(e) "") yr <- if (length(per) && nzchar(per[1])) per else "2022" dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yr) )  dat %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 6) ## # A tibble: 1 √ó 4 ##   Sex   Age   Year    value ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> ## 1 0     0     24    2374617

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: can also select using dimension codes. table, Sex codes 0 (Total), 1 (Male), 2 (Female). following equivalent:
code: yr <- tryCatch(tail(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), 1), error = function(e) "2022") dat_lbl <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yr) )  dat_code <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "0", Age = "0", Year = yr) )  list(rows_label = nrow(dat_lbl), rows_code = nrow(dat_code)) ## $rows_label ## [1] 1 ##  ## $rows_code ## [1] 1

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: Use labels argument add readable columns dimension:
code: per <- tryCatch(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), error = function(e) character()) yrs <- if (length(per) >= 2) tail(per, 2) else per if (!length(yrs)) yrs <- c("2021","2022") dat_labeled <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = c("Male","Female"), Age = "Total", Year = yrs),   labels = "en" )  dat_labeled %>% dplyr::select(dplyr::any_of(c("Year","Sex","value","Year_en","Sex_en"))) %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 8) ## # A tibble: 4 √ó 5 ##   Year  Sex     value Year_en Sex_en ##   <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>  ## 1 23    1     1176858 2001    Male   ## 2 24    1     1166478 2000    Male   ## 3 23    2     1221849 2001    Female ## 4 24    2     1208139 2000    Female

title: Getting started with mongolstats
text: dplyr, ‚Äôs straightforward summarise values year category:
code: per <- tryCatch(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), error = function(e) character()) yrs <- if (length(per) >= 5) tail(per, 5) else per if (!length(yrs)) yrs <- c("2018","2019","2020","2021","2022") dat_year <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = yrs) )  dat_year %>%   dplyr::group_by(Year) %>%   dplyr::summarise(value = sum(value, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%   dplyr::arrange(Year) %>%   dplyr::slice_head(n = 10) ## # A tibble: 5 √ó 2 ##   Year    value ##   <chr>   <dbl> ## 1 20    2474438 ## 2 21    2450790 ## 3 22    2425999 ## 4 23    2398707 ## 5 24    2374617

title: Caching and offline workflows
text: Cache speeds repeated calls table listings metadata. can also set TTL.
code: dir <- tryCatch(nso_cache_enable(ttl = 7 * 24 * 3600), error = function(e) NULL) dir ## [1] "~/.cache/mongolstats/v1"

title: Caching and offline workflows
code: nso_cache_status() ## $enabled ## [1] TRUE ##  ## $dir ## [1] "~/.cache/mongolstats/v1" ##  ## $has_cache ## [1] TRUE

title: Caching and offline workflows

title: Caching and offline workflows
text: Use caching development avoid repeated PXWeb metadata hits. Keep examples small guard network calls knitting documents (curl::has_internet()). reproducibility, store selections results; cache convenience, persistence layer.

title: Parallel batching and chunking
text: nso_package() accepts list (data frame) requests binds results.
code: reqs <- list(   list(tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2", selections = list(Year = "2024", Sex = "Total", Age = "Total")) ) res <- tryCatch(nso_package(reqs, labels = "code"), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) res %>% dplyr::slice_head(n = 5) ## # A tibble: 0 √ó 0

title: Parallel batching and chunking
text: future.apply installed, set parallel = TRUE compute requests concurrently. Control workers future::plan().
code: if (requireNamespace("future", quietly = TRUE) && requireNamespace("future.apply", quietly = TRUE)) {   future::plan(future::multisession, workers = 2)   res_par <- tryCatch(nso_package(reqs, labels = "code", parallel = TRUE), error = function(e) NULL)   future::plan(future::sequential) }

title: Parallel batching and chunking
text: avoid large requests, split dimension smaller chunks combine results.
code: years <- c("2020","2021","2022","2023","2024") chunks <- split(years, ceiling(seq_along(years) / 2))  # chunks of 2 parts <- lapply(chunks, function(yrs) {   tryCatch(nso_data("DT_NSO_0300_001V2", list(Year = yrs, Sex = "Total", Age = "Total"), labels = "code"), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) }) res_chunked <- dplyr::bind_rows(parts) if ("Year" %in% names(res_chunked)) {   res_chunked %>% dplyr::count(Year) } else {   tibble::tibble() } ## # A tibble: 0 √ó 0

title: Parallel batching and chunking
text: Enable package progress multi-request batches. Sequential (non-parallel) batches display progress bar cli available session interactive. Tips - Use caching (nso_cache_enable()) speed metadata lookups. - Prefer chunking across time dimension least-cardinality dimension. - Use parallel = TRUE independent requests, single huge table fetch.
code: options(mongolstats.progress = TRUE) res <- tryCatch(nso_package(reqs, labels = "code", parallel = FALSE), error = function(e) NULL)

title: Query builder: dims ‚Üí query ‚Üí fetch
text: Use nso_dims() list table dimensions nso_dim_values() inspect codes/labels dimension.
code: dims <- tryCatch(nso_dims("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) dims ## # A tibble: 3 √ó 4 ##   dim   code  is_time n_values ##   <chr> <chr> <lgl>      <int> ## 1 Sex   –•“Ø–π—Å  FALSE          3 ## 2 Age   –ù–∞—Å   FALSE         88 ## 3 Year  –û–Ω    FALSE         25 tryCatch(nso_dim_values("DT_NSO_0300_001V2", "Year", labels = "en") %>% slice_head(n = 6), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) ## # A tibble: 6 √ó 2 ##   code  label_en ##   <chr> <chr>    ## 1 0     2024     ## 2 1     2023     ## 3 2     2022     ## 4 3     2021     ## 5 4     2020     ## 6 5     2019

title: Query builder: dims ‚Üí query ‚Üí fetch
text: Construct query readable selections (codes labels). Print shows compact summary.
code: yr <- tryCatch(tail(nso_table_periods("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), 1), error = function(e) "2022") q <- nso_query(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Year = yr, Sex = c("Male","Female"), Age = "Total") ) q ## $tbl_id ## [1] "DT_NSO_0300_001V2" ##  ## $selections ## $selections$Year ## [1] "2000" ##  ## $selections$Sex ## [1] "Male"   "Female" ##  ## $selections$Age ## [1] "Total" ##  ##  ## attr(,"class") ## [1] "nso_query"

title: Query builder: dims ‚Üí query ‚Üí fetch
text: Use nso_fetch() run query. Add labels readability needed.
code: dat <- tryCatch(nso_fetch(q, labels = "en"), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) dat %>% select(dplyr::any_of(c("Year","Sex","Age","value","Year_en","Sex_en"))) %>% slice_head(n = 8) ## # A tibble: 2 √ó 6 ##   Year  Sex   Age     value Year_en Sex_en ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>  ## 1 24    1     0     1166478 2000    Male   ## 2 24    2     0     1208139 2000    Female

title: Query builder: dims ‚Üí query ‚Üí fetch
text: Use nso_dim_values(tbl, dim, labels = 'en') discover valid values. Selections accept codes labels; mongolstats maps labels codes. Enable caching faster iteration: nso_cache_enable().

title: Troubleshooting PXWeb requests
text: PXWeb requires selection every dimension. mongolstats includes unspecified dimensions automatically, invalid labels/codes still fail. Fix: Inspect dimensions values; select code label.
code: dims <- tryCatch(nso_dims("DT_NSO_0300_001V2"), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) vals_year <- tryCatch(nso_dim_values("DT_NSO_0300_001V2", "Year", labels = "en"), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) head(vals_year) ## # A tibble: 6 √ó 2 ##   code  label_en ##   <chr> <chr>    ## 1 0     2024     ## 2 1     2023     ## 3 2     2022     ## 4 3     2021     ## 5 4     2020     ## 6 5     2019

title: Troubleshooting PXWeb requests
text: labels used codes required, mongolstats maps labels codes possible. ambiguous, errors candidates. Fix: Prefer exact labels nso_dim_values() select codes directly.
code: q <- nso_query("DT_NSO_0300_001V2", list(Year = "2024", Sex = c("Male","Female"), Age = "Total")) dat <- tryCatch(nso_fetch(q, labels = "en"), error = function(e) tibble::tibble()) head(dat) ## # A tibble: 2 √ó 7 ##   Sex   Age   Year    value Sex_en Age_en Year_en ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>  <chr>  <chr>   ## 1 1     0     0     1696862 Male   Total  2024    ## 2 2     0     0     1744736 Female Total  2024

title: Troubleshooting PXWeb requests
text: Large selections can slow rejected. Reduce number values per dimension, fetch batches. Tips: - Narrow Year range category lists. - Fetch multiple slices bind_rows() . - Use caching avoid repeated metadata calls: nso_cache_enable(ttl = 7 * 24 * 3600).

title: Troubleshooting PXWeb requests
text: offline mode enabled, network calls error fast typed condition.
code: nso_offline_enable() try(nso_sectors(), silent = TRUE) ## # A tibble: 8 √ó 3 ##   id                    type  text                  ##   <chr>                 <chr> <chr>                 ## 1 Economy, environment  l     Economy, environment  ## 2 Education, health     l     Education, health     ## 3 Historical data       l     Historical data       ## 4 Industry, service     l     Industry, service     ## 5 Labour, business      l     Labour, business      ## 6 Population, household l     Population, household ## 7 Regional development  l     Regional development  ## 8 Society, development  l     Society, development nso_offline_disable()

title: Troubleshooting PXWeb requests
text: Enable verbose logging inspect URLs payloads.
code: options(mongolstats.verbose = TRUE) invisible(try(nso_data("DT_NSO_0300_001V2", list(Year = "2024", Sex = "Total", Age = "Total")), silent = TRUE)) options(mongolstats.verbose = FALSE)

title: Troubleshooting PXWeb requests
text: Discover nso_itms() + nso_search(); inspect nso_dims() nso_dim_values(). Keep examples fast; cache metadata development. Prefer code selections stable scripts; add labels via labels = 'en' needed. Guard long-running chunks vignettes internet checks.

title: mongolstats
text: Tidy access National Statistics Office Mongolia (NSO) statistics via PXWeb API (data.1212.mn) Mongolia administrative boundaries, inspired ergonomics tidycensus. Provides tidyverse-friendly interface discovering tables, exploring codebooks, fetching data, working sf geometries mapping.

title: mongolstats
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("temuulene/mongolstats")

title: mongolstats
code: library(mongolstats) library(dplyr)  # Use new PXWeb API (data.1212.mn) nso_options(mongolstats.lang = "en")  # List available tables itms <- nso_itms() itms %>% select(tbl_id, tbl_eng_nm, strt_prd, end_prd) %>% slice_head(n = 5)  # Inspect variables (codebook) for a table vars <- nso_variables("DT_NSO_0300_001V2") vars %>% count(field)  # Fetch data dat <- nso_data(   tbl_id = "DT_NSO_0300_001V2",   selections = list(Sex = "Total", Age = "Total", Year = "2024") ) dat %>% slice_head(n = 6)

title: mongolstats
text: PXWeb client NSO data (data.1212.mn) Discover tables variables nso_itms() / nso_itms_detail() Fetch data via nso_data(tbl_id, selections=...); batch nso_package() Optional label columns English Mongolian (labels = "en" | "mn" | "") Category navigation table search helpers Mongolia administrative boundaries (ADM0‚ÄìADM2) sf Exact fuzzy name-based boundary joins Lightweight -disk caching faster table/codebook lookups

title: mongolstats 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial development snapshot. NSO API wrappers: nso_itms(), nso_itms_detail(), nso_data(), nso_package() Sector helpers: nso_sectors(), nso_subsectors(), nso_search() Boundaries: mn_boundaries(), join helpers incl.¬†fuzzy joins Caching discovery endpoints Vignettes getting started, mapping, fuzzy joins, code-based joins
